Package se.arkalix.core.plugin.eh

Class HttpJsonEventSubscriberPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.core.plugin.eh.HttpJsonEventSubscriberPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArEventSubscriberPlugin, se.arkalix.plugin.Plugin
    public class HttpJsonEventSubscriberPlugin
extends java.lang.Object
implements ArEventSubscriberPlugin
    HTTP/JSON event subscriber plugin.

    This plugin helps manage subscriptions for events using the HttpJsonEventSubscribeService and HttpJsonEventUnsubscribeService services. It assumes that only one version of each of these services are available to the ArSystem it attaches to, and uses them to register and deregister event subscriptions.

    Subscriptions are currently assumed to remain valid for the entire lifetime of the system this plugin attaches to. No renewal attempts are made automatically.

    Use of this plugin requires either that the mentioned services are preloaded into the service cache of built systems, or that a plugin that performs service resolution is loaded before this plugin. If a preloaded service cache is used, make sure that its entries do not expire during the lifetime of any subscribing systems.

      • subscribe

        public HttpJsonEventSubscriberPlugin subscribe​(EventSubscription subscription)
        Description copied from interface: ArEventSubscriberPlugin
        Registers new default event subscription.

        The default event subscriptions added to this plugin are added to each system it is attached to. For this reason, these subscriptions cannot be cancelled in any other way than shutting down the systems this plugin is attached to. If wanting to create subscriptions that are more readily cancellable, use the ArSystem.pluginFacadeOf(Class) method and cast its successful result to ArEventSubscriberPluginFacade, like so: 

             var system = new System.Builder()
         (...)
         .plugins(new HttpJsonEventSubscriberPlugin())
         .build();
     system.pluginFacadeOf(HttpJsonEventSubscriberPlugin.class)
         .map(facade -> (ArEventSubscriberPluginFacade) facade)
         .ifPresent(facade -> {...});
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface ArEventSubscriberPlugin
        Parameters:
        subscription - Subscription to register.
        Returns:
        This builder.
